themes: funding structures prioritize compliance over creativity
need for clearer, merit-based evaluation criteria
lack of philosophical and artistic diversity on jury panels
insufficient support for mid-career and future-facing artists
overemphasis on identity or victim-centered frameworks
desire for plurality of narratives and aesthetics
key_phrases: Current funding structures often reward compliance over creativity
Clearer, merit-based evaluation criteria that go beyond identity or messaging
Jury panels with broader philosophical and artistic diversity
Support for mid-career and future-facing artists
not just emerging voices or those fitting into victim-centered frameworks
A 'yes, and' approach that welcomes a plurality of narratives and aesthetics
barriers_identified: funding structures reward compliance over creativity
evaluation criteria limited to identity or messaging
jury panels lack philosophical and artistic diversity
support focused on emerging or victim-centered artists
solutions_proposed: implement clearer, merit-based evaluation criteria that go beyond identity or messaging
form jury panels with broader philosophical and artistic diversity
increase support for mid-career and future-facing artists
adopt a 'yes, and' approach that welcomes a plurality of narratives and aesthetics
